meanings.definition: The quality of being able to adjust to new conditions or circumstances.
meanings.sent1: Her adaptiveness in learning new skills quickly impressed her teachers.
meanings.sent2: The adaptiveness of the chameleon allows it to blend into its surroundings effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The adaptiveness of the puzzle-solving robot made it the star of the competition.
meanings.sent4: His adaptiveness in navigating through the busy city streets was like that of a seasoned taxi driver.
meanings.sent5: The adaptiveness of the plant to different climates made it a popular choice for gardeners.

meanings.definition: The ability to change or modify behavior in response to different situations.
meanings.sent1: The adaptiveness of the team captain in adjusting strategies led to their victory.
meanings.sent2: Children often show adaptiveness when faced with new challenges.
meanings.sent3: The adaptiveness of the cat in finding new hiding spots amused the whole family.
meanings.sent4: Her adaptiveness in handling difficult customers was like that of a seasoned salesperson.
meanings.sent5: The adaptiveness of the actor in different roles made him a versatile performer.
